snippet.title: 13 questions with Boston Mayor Marty Walsh
snippet.description: Boston's new mayor sits down to talk the marathon, Elizabeth Warren, Joe Biden, and his first 100 days

snippet.title: Police: Man pelted woman at egg decorating party
snippet.description: Pittsburgh police say a man threw hardboiled eggs at his girlfriend during an Easter egg decorating party, then tried to attack police.

snippet.title: Fracking foes cringe as unions back drilling boom
snippet.description: After early complaints that out-of-state firms got the most jobs, some local construction trade workers and union members in Pennsylvania, Ohio and West Virginia say they're now benefiting in a big way from the Marcellus and Utica Shale oil and gas boom.

snippet.title: Exhibit recreates Warhol's 1964 World's Fair mural
snippet.description: Even for a 1964 New York World's Fair that celebrated "The World of Tomorrow," Andy Warhol may have been ahead of his time.

snippet.title: As medical providers consolidate, questions about effects on costs, quality of care
snippet.description: A costly legal fight is pushing back against the merger mania gripping the U.S. medical system.

snippet.title: A white supremacist Web site frequented by killers
snippet.description: Nine men who were allegedly prolific posters on the white supremacist Web site Stormfront were responsible for killing almost 100 people over the past five years, according to the Southern Poverty Law Center.

snippet.title: When will we learn: Nothing is secure on the Internet
snippet.description: The fallout from Heartbleed and security breaches at major retailers continues.

snippet.title: Steelers sign P Adam Podlesh
snippet.description: The Pittsburgh Steelers have signed punter Adam Podlesh to a one-year contract.
